fields.summary: No permite crear nueva pizarra tipo scrum en Jira Cloud

fields.description:
I see the Agile Board's page title includes the name of the board, but for some reason when I open a new tab in Chrome and type 'agile' in the address bar it shows in the autocomplete the URLs of a few boards I use regularly, BUT it doesn't include the board names. The 'title' of the page that's shown after the url in the autocomplete is just 'Agile Board - JIRA', i.e. excluding the board name. This is a very small thing but makes it harder to find the board I want: I either need to remember the ID of the board or choose one randomly and see if it's the right one. Sure, I can then use the Agile menu to find the one I want, but if you could get the board's name appearing in that autocomplete list that'd be fantastic. 

Maybe this is because chrome is displaying the page title when the page loads but before javascript is run - it seems that the title is updated to include the board name only after page load.
fields.summary: Ensure agile board name appears in url autocomplete in Chrome

fields.description:
The request is to add the "Ticket Type" to ALL email notifications.

The issue: as far as I learned in documentations and forums there is a way to do it with on premise implementation by "velocity template" .
But we do use the online Jira service (SaaS).

Is there a way I still can do it? Or at least is there a way for you as a Service Provider to do it for Ravello?

This is important for us since we use same Project for multiple Operational activities (Changes / Problems / Incidents) and the users want to distinguish between types in their email filters.

Thanks, Gilad.
fields.summary: Change the email template for or Ravello Jira

fields.description:
Currently, users in Cloud cannot be deleted, if they have content related to them. They can only be disabled.

In some cases, content from disabled users may not be useful anymore, due to, for example, an employee leaving the company.

It would be useful to have a tool that would allow administrators to cascade delete all content created by a user along with the user, taking less space and making the instance cleaner.
fields.summary: Cascade delete content from a user

fields.description:
When text is pasted between a heading and a code block the pasted text is inserted into the code block instead of between the heading and the code block.

Steps to reproduce in 5.8-OD-51-008:
* Create new wiki page
* Put this content on the page:
a H1 heading
a code block under the H1 heading
* Put cursor at the end of the H1 text
* Press enter
* Paste in some text

Result is that the text is pasted inside the code block.
fields.summary: Paste text after heading before code block mispastes

Let me know if you need any more information! :)

Cheers, 
Ivar
fields.summary: Cloud link in e-mail
RELATÓRIO DE PROCEDIMENTOS FATURADOS IMN

fields.description:
As a product manager, I want to easily create a story for the board I'm currently looking at,  so that I can quickly add and prioritize emerging support tasks or urgent improvements.

h2. Current Behavior

Product managers often work with multiple dev teams, and therefore work within multiple JIRA projects

# Open two boards for two different projects in two tabs
# Hit Create button in one tab, and make sure to actually create and save a ticket to that board
# Switch to the second tab
# Hit the Create button in the second tab
# The new ticket is created for the first board
# User must Move the ticket to the desired place

h2. Desired behavior

# Open two boards for two different projects in two tabs
# Hit Create button in one tab, and make sure to actually create and save a ticket to that board
# Switch to the second tab
# Hit the Create button in the second tab
# The new ticket is created for the second board

*Rule:* Tickets should be created in the current project, unless there's no obvious project, in which case tickets should be created in the last project to have a ticket created
fields.summary: Create button respects existing user context

fields.description:
i.e https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-Renamingusers is still saying we can't change username. 
{quote}You currently cannot change (edit) usernames in your cloud applications; however, you are able to change a user's name and email address by editing the user in the user management pages.{quote}

Thanks in advance,
Rodrigo Silva | Cloud Support

fields.description:
Notify administrators for user creation doesn't work when user created by an admin. It only works when a user sign up.

# Have 2 administrators
# Create a user using 1 administrator and the other administrator doesn't receive any notification
fields.summary: Notify administrators for user creation doesn't work when user created by an admin

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Native JQL has limited features for querying issues based on link information. The JQL Tricks plugin is of great help, but this is not available for Jira Cloud users, it's only supported in Server version.

h3. Suggested Solution
Get the JQL Tricks plugin supported by Jira Cloud.

h3. Workaround 
Switch to Confluence Server if you need to use this plugin.
fields.summary: Make the JQL Tricks plugin available in Jira Cloud

User will receive the invitation email.

fields.description:
*Issue*
Currently when enabling dark features within JIRA Cloud, the text field that accepts a dark feature component allows for any text to be typed in. **screenshot attached

*Expected behavior*
When typing text into this field and clicking the 'Add' button, the field should validate against a list of known / current dark features. If the text does not match a dark feature, a message should be displayed indicating this. **see screenshot
fields.summary: No check against text is performed when enabled dark features

fields.description:
Ideally each CAC page that provides documentation, would include a table of all known issues/bugs that pertain to said topic. Quite often we see features/bugs in customer comments but it would nice to have a placeholder (template) to centralize them.

Additionally, it would be nice if the CAC pages were consistent, for example:

This page has a TOC section:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Importing+a+Confluence+Site

This page does not despite substantial content:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Configuring+Workflow
fields.summary: CAC Documentation > Build in a placeholder for Features/Bugs

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 18 July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We apologize for the lack of updates on this request. Atlassian account has supported two-step verification since it was fully rolled out. This includes using verification apps like Duo. Here's more information on [how to configure two-step verification for an individual Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/secure-your-account-with-two-step-verification-939505063.html].

Organizations can [require that all accounts at their company enable two-step verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/enforced-two-step-verification-938859738.html] with a subscription to [Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access].

Regards,
Dave Meyer
Principal Product Manager, Atlassian Access
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It is currently possible to use Duo Security for two-factor authentication in both [JIRA Server |https://www.duosecurity.com/docs/jira] and [Confluence Server|https://www.duosecurity.com/docs/confluence].

However, this feature is not available yet for Cloud applications.
h3. Suggested Solution

Support for this feature in Cloud would allow a better security control.
h3. Workaround

Link Cloud with [Google Apps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Google+Apps+Integration+FAQ] and set up two-factor on Google's end.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to use Duo two-factor security for user logins

fields.description:

fields.description:
I too noticed today at critical point, I can no longer create the project type we need. 
I disagree with CLOUD-7806.  This is not an improvement.  This is a BUG.  


Cloned issue. see below.

I noticed today that the JIRA Classic project template appears to have disappeared from some Atlassian Cloud instances of JIRA.  Hopefully this is just an oversight and it will be reinstated soon.

If the case is that this move was deliberate, then I am opposed to its removal.  Managing JIRA as an administrator, especially at the enterprise level, is complicated by the number of schemes in the JIRA instance.  Having separate workflows, issue type schemes, issue type screen schemes, screen schemes, and screens for every single JIRA project is unmanageable when dealing with a large number of projects.  This is why I have always used the JIRA Classic/Default template since the introduction of Project Templates, as it creates no new schemes.  For a responsible JIRA administrator, applying the correct schemes is significantly less work than replacing and deleting unwanted schemes.
fields.summary: Project Type - Default Classic Project Type Missing

Jira: 6.4-OD-15-055
Browser: Latest Safari on OS X Yosemite

fields.description:
Customer performed import and was locked out of many of the Global Permissions 

The groups defined in Global Permissions did not exist in User Management. 

See step 2 here:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Importing+Issues
{quote}
The import process renames default JIRA groups to Cloud application groups as follows.

*Original JIRA groups / Cloud groups*
jira-administrators  ----->  administrators
jira-developers       ------>  developers
jira-user                 --------> users
{quote}
This didn't happen and thus, the customer was effectively locked out as being Admin.
fields.summary: The import process did not rename default JIRA groups to Cloud application groups

fields.description:
Hi,
The current limitation on exporting Jira tickets from the Cloud to Excel is 1,000. As a user, I understand that this limit helps with performance, but I also understand that this limitation is a few years old. My assumption, again as a remote user, would be that hardware and software improvements across the years may halp relax some limitations to some extent.

Would you please consider increasing this limit from 1,000 to 5,000 (or at least 2,000)?

Original discussion is here: https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-135495
fields.summary: Please increase the 1000 limit to exporting issues

fields.description: If a transition to a status is set to all (where a user can transition to a status from any other status), the user is given the option to transition to that status, even from the same status, which may cause confusion to the end user. While the product might be functioning as intended (for instance, the user might want to keep the status the same but add a description or comment to the status, or have a specific screen pop up to add more info for that status), it would be useful to have a feature to allow the customer to select All for the transition, but be able to select or unselect the same status.
fields.summary: If Transition to Status Set to All, Option to Set Status to Same Status Should Not be Available

fields.description:
It is not possible to revoke "View, Add, Delete and Export" permissions to a space by following the steps below:

# Remove the access of all other groups and individual users. Only the space creator must have permissions to it.
# With an Admin user type g+g "Space Permissions" and select "manage permissions" of the recent project. It will throws a "Page Not Found".

I believe that by revoking the permissions of certain space the admin would be able to manage all permissions again.
fields.summary: Revoking access on Confluence Space does not recover all permissions

fields.description:
Customer cannot transition out of the "Link" window as the Link and Cancel options are not displayed in the window at higher zoom levels.  The issue does not seem to be browser specific as it can be replicated in IE, Chrome, Firefox, and Safari at higher zoom levels.

*Steps to Reproduce*
1) Log in to JIRA
2) Click the Issues menu
3) Select any issue
4) Increase the browser zoom level (above150% will usually replicate the issue)
5) Navigate to the More menu
6) Click the Link option

*Workaround*
Users can zoom out in their browser or change their screen resolutions so the options appear.

*Recommendation*
Allow the Link window to resize according to the screen resolution/browser zoom level. All other windows such as the "Log Work" resize accordingly at higher zoom levels. 

The screenshots show the Link window and the Log Work window at the same zoom level with the Link window not resizing properly.
fields.summary: "Link" window in Jira Cloud has Missing Buttons When Zoomed In

fields.description:
As described in [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Atlassian+Cloud+Storage+Policy], Cloud users only have 25GB of disk storage available.

However, the applications don't give the customer a way to check disk usage, to see how much of the 25GB their using and how much space they have left.

As a customer and a site administrator, I'd like to be able to see the disk usage so I have a better control.
fields.summary: Display disk usage statistics in Cloud applications in UI visible to administrators

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Contextual feature discovery Help menu in Cloud is distracting. Nearly every day there is new Atlassian news under *Learn* section of menu, causing a red badge to appear over the question mark icon:

!Screen Shot 2015-03-11 at 12.25.20.jpg|thumbnail!

!Screen Shot 2015-03-11 at 12.25.28.jpg|thumbnail!

h4. Issue
This is distracting to users, and there doesn't appear to be a way to disable it

h4. Solution
* Create a way to disable it
* Use some other way to mention of new entries and ease of clearing them
* Only important notices or updates should have the *{color:#d04437}red{color}* badge
fields.summary: Help Menu Updates are Distracting

As a user creating and updating tickets, I need to update *JIRA Issue* link information so that I do not have to delete an existing link and create a new link for the same ticket (i.e., waste time). For example, I'd like to change "This ticket is related to..." to "This ticket is blocked by..."

Secondary
As a user creating and updating tickets, I need to update "Web Link" link text so that I do not have to delete an existing link and create a new link for the same URL (i.e., waste time).

_By the way, I'm surprised all of these fields are open to me, outside of Atlassian_:
!Screen Shot 2015-03-10 at 9.25.36 AM.png!

fields.description:
h4. Current behaviour

When creating a user and applying application access, the current license count is not displayed.

!Screen Shot 2015-02-26 at 12.00.19.jpg|thumbnail!

However, when adding access via Application access, you have this:

!Screen Shot 2015-02-26 at 12.00.30.jpg|thumbnail!

h4. Requested behaviour

Either show the current used, or switch back to old behaviour to let users know if they are going over their current license limit.

The issue here is that if a user goes over their license limit, they will not be able to see it from this screen, and will be charged for the next license tier, if applicable.
fields.summary: When granting access to application upon user creation, display user count

Thanks !
fields.summary: Error not display embedded video in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
If an add-on is transitioning from Free to Paid subscription, customers who subscribed to the Free version is charged for the Paid subscription although permission wasn't granted.

(For example, the Gantt Cloud add-on by WISOFT recently went through this transition at version 1.1.0 of their add-on).

Once a Paid version is released, Universal Plugin Manager (UPM) will attempt to upgrade. From the UPM audit log:

bq. Attempted automatic update of add-on Gantt Cloud (1.1.0)

Afterwards UPM prevents the upgrade as it needs customer permission:

bq. Gantt Cloud (1.1.0) failed to automatically update because it needs your permission first.

Unfortunately it also resulted in an unexpected charge on the billing. In this example, customer has to pay for the "Paid" version even without approving it.
fields.summary: Customers may get charged from available paid add-ons update

fields.description:
We are looking for a feature that allows new comments to be highlighted in some way since the user last visited an issue.

This question came up for users who are not using email notifications. The team has a high issue turnover and email notifications and activity streams generate too much noise. Since the team collaborate to solve issues, there may be new activity on the issue (new comments) that should be highlighted when the page is visited.

To reiterate, I do not want to highlight comments. What I want is that new comments will be highlighted by JIRA when I visit an issue. Specifically I want JIRA to highlight new comments since my last visit to the issue.
fields.summary: Auto-highlight new comments since last visit to issue

fields.summary: Insert Image into Comment Uses "Thumbnail" and Image does not appear

fields.description:
Glad to see we can now format without typing Wiki Mark-Up. However, my cursor keeps disappearing. This _seems_ to happen if I have pasted text into the Comment field as opposed to typing new.

Please fix.
fields.summary: New Commenting Formatting Loses Cursor

fields.description:
It would be best to add a possibility for users to not allow certain actions when assigning tickets. 

Sample:
users A cannot assign tickets to user B if label is empty.
fields.summary: It should be possible to create certain flow for assigning JIRA as well

fields.description:
When you are over your license limit, while on Annual Plan, (e.g. 14 users out of 10) then you are also not able to add existing users to groups

The error message is a bit vague and will appear to users that the system believes they are trying to add a new user to the license.
fields.summary: Unable to manage groups for users when you are over your license limit on annual license

fields.description: In OnDemand, if a user wishes to force a language across products, they must visit each application's administration to change these settings. Furthermore, the preferences for Confluence specifically can be overridden by a user's browser language preference while JIRA doesn't behave in this way. There should be a single location to set the instance language and have that preference be persisted in all applications in the same way. Amongst the things needed to achieve this, the system preference for Confluence "confluence.browser.language.enabled" would need to be disabled.
fields.summary: Default OnDemand Language Preference Across Products

fields.description:
Procedure:
 - Aims at embedding a google document into a Confluence wiki page.
 - To repeat: edit a wiki page, press "Insert" and select "Other Macros". From the resulting view, select a "Google document".
 - Google document picker appears.

The problem: One cannot enter any filtering tect to "Title contains" -field. The field (id="gdocspicker-titleFilter") is disabled (i.e. html attribute disabled:disabled is set).

Expected operation: One can enter text into the "Title contains" -field thereby filtering the list of available documents.

Background should be ok, tested by removing the disabled attribute with Firebug and worked fine as a result.
fields.summary: Google document picker "Title contains" field is disabled when embedding a document to a wiki page via Insert->Other macros->Google document

fields.description:
The preview that the Google docs presentation macro in Confluence generates does not change to reflect changes in the underlying Google docs presentation.

Steps to reproduce:
* create a Google presentation
* create a wiki page with the Google presentation macro, showing the presentation created above
* view the page, the preview should appear
* edit the presentation
* view the wiki page again, the preview will still show the old version of the presentation

This could be fixed by tweaking the response headers, which are currently:

!google-presentation-response.png!
fields.summary: Google docs presentation macro preview not updated with underlying doc change

fields.description:
Customer is attempting to create an AppLink to their BTF JIRA instance which utilizes SSL. 

Testing the SSL Cert for the BTF instance generates the below error message:
bq. Java 6u45 No SNI 2	Client does not support DH parameters > 1024 bits

Their server application is failing to communicate with our Confluence application due to our Java version. 

As the Cloud is still on Java 6 "Java Version	1.6.0_26," it won't be able to talk to their JIRA via that SSL.
fields.summary: JDK 1.8 for Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
Suggestions: 
1) include more information about how the import tool handle the users and configurations. 
2) Please review the instruction for Windows WebDAC Client. Maybe you can add a config example for a specific vendor.
fields.summary: Improvement in WebDAV documentation

fields.description:
We want to completely move our hosted JIRA environment and Client Service Processes into JIRA cloud but only on the crucial condition that we would have the possibility to communicate with our clients in their native language - Czech. We offer our full collaboration on the [Czech translation project|https://translations.atlassian.com/dashboard/dashboard?lang=cs_CZ].

If we guarantee the readiness of the Czech language pack for JIRA in a given period of time, will you guarantee to add the Czech language support in general configuration (site default) and user profile preferences?
fields.summary: Add Czech language to cloud JIRA in exchange for our participation in translation project

fields.description:
Customer is requesting the ability to set password policy regarding length, special character... Since for now the password can only be restricted regarding its lenght.

Example:
- Minimum 8 characteres
- Uppercase and lowercase
- Number
fields.summary: Improve password policy

fields.description:
Confluence General Configuration:
# Go to https://<any-cloud-instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/viewgeneralconfig.action
# Under General Configuration


Server Base URL https://<any-cloud-instance>.atlassian.net/wiki
The Server Base URL is the url via which users access Confluence. [More about the Server Base URL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Configuring+the+Server+Base+URL] is invalid
fields.summary: Confluence General Administration > Invalid Link Configuring the Server Base URL
Check login

fields.description: When trying to support customers, presenting surveys/quickstart guides to sysadmin is a complete waste of time and prevents support engineers from providing timely responses, and the data collected is irrelevant.  The only people with sysadmin access are internal to Atlassian, so this should never be shown.
fields.summary: Surveys or Quick Start functionality SHOULD NOT be shown to sysadmin in Cloud instances

fields.description:
In the section *Step 2. Export the space content from the source Confluence site*, [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Importing+a+Confluence+Space] the last paragraph contains two invalid links:
# Exporting Confluence Pages and Spaces to XML (for Confluence Cloud sites) brings you [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=Cloud&title=Exporting+Confluence+Pages+and+Spaces+to+XML&linkCreation=true&fromPageId=692420687]
#  Exporting Confluence Pages and Spaces to XML (for Confluence Server sites) brings you [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=DOC&title=Exporting+Confluence+Pages+and+Spaces+to+XML]
fields.summary: Two Invalid Links in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Importing+a+Confluence+Space
Make it possible to rename labels

fields.description: In the Create Issue dialog there is a "Create another" checkbox which, if checked, causes the dialog to remain open after the issue creation is complete, ready to continue and create another issue. This is a good UI feature. The Create Worklog dialog could do with the same mechanism. In fact we would use it more there, as we often add several worklogs at a time to the same issue.
fields.summary: Add "create another" checkbox to Create Worklog dialog, like Create Issue has.

fields.description: Add Chinese language support to Cloud
fields.summary: Add Simplified Chinese Support

fields.description:
Please replace OnDemand with Cloud for the two mentioned occurrences: 
{quote}
Can I log in to Atlassian OnDemand with my Atlassian ID?
Not at this time. You'll continue to use a separate login for Atlassian OnDemand. A more comprehensive solution is on our roadmap. 
{quote}
The page is here:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Purchasing/Atlassian+ID+FAQ

Do we have a way to search/replace CAC for other references to OnDemand?
fields.summary: Replace OnDemand with Cloud https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Purchasing/Atlassian+ID+FAQ

fields.description:
See https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Application+Versions

Shows the following:
 JIRA Service Desk	   2.3-OD-07	21 January 2015

However, the current version running in the Cloud platform is 2.3-OD-05
fields.summary: Cloud Application Versions page shows wrong version of Service Desk.

fields.description:
The new method of adding an application to a Cloud instance is via the *Billing* menu under the *Settings*

If you click the Application Switcher in the top-left, and click the new product under *Try Other Atlassian Apps*, it just takes you to the page on www.atlassian.com to order the product.

The client will then try to put in their existing instance name, and the system will not allow it, of course, because the URL already exists.

This menu should instead take them to the Billing screen where you would add a new app to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: When ordering from Application Switcher, system tries to order a new instance

fields.description:
Sometimes in Cloud, you will get a pop-up notification for something like a survey, or to tell you your timezone differs from the one set. These are just examples.

There will be no {{X}} in the top right-hand corner to close it until you mouse-over.

This is confusing at times and will cause users to just leave the window open, which blocks their experience.

Perhaps make the {{X}} always there so they do not have to search for it.
fields.summary: Make it more obvious how to close a pop-up notification

fields.description:
The technical restrictions imposed by the Atlassian Cloud framework make it impossible for an add-on to access the Confluence task API.

It would be ideal to have the same freedom in the Cloud platform as there's on Server.

Any updates would be appreciated.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow add-ons to access the Confluence task API.
Add Estonian
There was a problem converting this attachment. Please create an issue at http://jira.atlassian.com

fields.description: When user ryan_bergstrom  log in to JIRA using this URL: https://cycle30.atlassian.net/login?dest-url=%2Fsecure%2FDashboard.jspa all is well.  But when he search for a ticket he get booted out with the first print screen below showing up.  Then when helog in from that screen he get the second print screen below.  In essence heI can not see anything that is not assigned to him.
fields.summary: User logged out from the portal after login

fields.description: Our hosted cloud Confluence had an error when trying to use the PowerPoint macro for an attachment.
fields.summary: Powerpoint macro showing an error

fields.description:
In cloud instances that have integration with Google Apps, users hold both a local and a Google password, as can be read [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Changing+Your+Atlassian+Cloud+Password]. This second is used for access RSS feeds and for use with the Atlassian IDE Connectors.

As a customer, I would like an option to configure an automatic synchronization between Google and local password, by updating one when the other is modify. This way, there will be no need to memorize two different passwords.
fields.summary: Allow local and Google Apps password syncing

fields.description:
There was no choice for a HipChat Project, so I chose Atlassian Cloud.

I'm requesting a feature where @-mentions within JIRA and Confluence create an alert to that person in HipChat.
fields.summary: HipChat integration for @-mentions

fields.description:
Examples of error messages that are not helpful:

**Manage Applications**

OnDemand shows this error when customers are trying to reactivate an application with an outstanding quote (*expired* or *pending renewal*):

bq. Error activating product confluence.ondemand

!error.jpg|thumbnail!

**Add Ons**

When an instance has expired, add-ons cannot be added and throws the following error.

 {{An unexpected error occurred. Refer to the logs for more information.}}

!2014-11-13_12h40_12.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: More Meaningful Error Message for Expired Subscriptions
